classes.title: PORT101
classes.subtitle: Elementary Portuguese I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the essential elements of Portuguese structure and vocabulary and aspects of Brazilian and Portuguese culture. Aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing are stressed in that order. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�101 and PORT�111 or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT102
classes.subtitle: Elementary Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the essential elements of Portuguese structure and vocabulary and aspects of Brazilian and Portuguese culture. Aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing are stressed in that order. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�101 and PORT�111 or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT102
classes.subtitle: Elementary Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continues study of essential elements of Portuguese structure, vocabulary, and aspects of Brazilian and Portuguese culture. Aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing are stressed in that order.  Students may not receive credit for both PORT�102 and PORT�111 or 401.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�101.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT111
classes.subtitle: Intensive Elementary Portuguese.  6 Credits.
classes.description: Continues study of essential elements of Portuguese structure, vocabulary, and aspects of Brazilian and Portuguese culture. Aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing are stressed in that order.  Students may not receive credit for both PORT�102 and PORT�111 or 401.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�101.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT111
classes.subtitle: Intensive Elementary Portuguese.  6 Credits.
classes.description: Covers the material of the PORT�101 and 102 sequence in a single semester. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�111 and PORT�101, 102, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT203
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Portuguese I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Covers the material of the PORT�101 and 102 sequence in a single semester. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�111 and PORT�101, 102, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT203
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Portuguese I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Further development of language with emphasis on speaking, writing, and a review of grammar. Includes advanced Portuguese structures, cultural and literary texts. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�203 and PORT�212 or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT204
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Further development of language with emphasis on speaking, writing, and a review of grammar. Includes advanced Portuguese structures, cultural and literary texts. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�203 and PORT�212 or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT204
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continued development of language skills for communication. Further study of grammar. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�204 and PORT�212 or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�203.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT212
classes.subtitle: Intensive Intermediate Portuguese.  6 Credits.
classes.description: Continued development of language skills for communication. Further study of grammar. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�204 and PORT�212 or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�203.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT212
classes.subtitle: Intensive Intermediate Portuguese.  6 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of PORT�111; covers the material of PORT�203 and 204 in one semester. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�212 and PORT�203, 204, or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT310
classes.subtitle: Advanced Communication in Portuguese: Media & Entertainment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of PORT�111; covers the material of PORT�203 and 204 in one semester. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�212 and PORT�203, 204, or 402.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT310
classes.subtitle: Advanced Communication in Portuguese: Media & Entertainment.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Development of speaking skills through discussion of media, popular music, and selected texts.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402.Gen Ed: CI.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT316
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Performance in Music and Dance: Capoeira.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Development of speaking skills through discussion of media, popular music, and selected texts.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402.Gen Ed: CI.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT316
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Performance in Music and Dance: Capoeira.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of Brazilian capoeira from its roots to the present day. Focus on verbal and nonverbal discourse experienced through the rules, songs, movements, rhythms, rituals of capoeira. In English; credit for major/minor in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: VP, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT323
classes.subtitle: Advanced Communication in Portuguese: History, Nature, and Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of Brazilian capoeira from its roots to the present day. Focus on verbal and nonverbal discourse experienced through the rules, songs, movements, rhythms, rituals of capoeira. In English; credit for major/minor in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: VP, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT323
classes.subtitle: Advanced Communication in Portuguese: History, Nature, and Society.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Emphasizes the learning of Portuguese through cultural context. Language, society, and miscegenation will be approached through texts and films. Focus on important aspects of religion, festivities, and popular music from the Portuguese-speaking countries of three continents.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402.Gen Ed: HS, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT351
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Interpretation I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Emphasizes the learning of Portuguese through cultural context. Language, society, and miscegenation will be approached through texts and films. Focus on important aspects of religion, festivities, and popular music from the Portuguese-speaking countries of three continents.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402.Gen Ed: HS, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT351
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Interpretation I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the profession of interpreter: main interpretation models, history and theory, use of cognitive processes in developing skills, ethical standards, and best practices. Emphasis on expanding communicative and cultural competency while applying strategies in business, conference interpretation, education, health care, and law enforcement.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�310 or 388.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT352
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Interpretation II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces the profession of interpreter: main interpretation models, history and theory, use of cognitive processes in developing skills, ethical standards, and best practices. Emphasis on expanding communicative and cultural competency while applying strategies in business, conference interpretation, education, health care, and law enforcement.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�310 or 388.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT352
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Interpretation II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Refines interpretation skills through continued study of theory and best practices in varied professional contexts. Focuses on enhancing linguistic competence, sight-translation, and mnemonic strategies. Increases cultural sensitivity to issues interpreters face in business, conference interpretation, education, health care, the hospitality industry, law, and social services.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�351.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT354
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Translation I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Refines interpretation skills through continued study of theory and best practices in varied professional contexts. Focuses on enhancing linguistic competence, sight-translation, and mnemonic strategies. Increases cultural sensitivity to issues interpreters face in business, conference interpretation, education, health care, the hospitality industry, law, and social services.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�351.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT354
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Translation I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to translation theory, history and methods, and the basic elements of Portuguese-to-English and English-to-Portuguese translation through a variety of prose styles. Upon completion, students should be able to demonstrate usage and understanding of the elementary processes involved in translating.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�323 or 385.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT355
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Translation II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to translation theory, history and methods, and the basic elements of Portuguese-to-English and English-to-Portuguese translation through a variety of prose styles. Upon completion, students should be able to demonstrate usage and understanding of the elementary processes involved in translating.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�323 or 385.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT355
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Translation II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Refines translation skills in cultural and consumer-oriented, financial, legal, literary, medical, and technical domains. Emphasis on expanding written proficiency and refining style, translating representative texts from diverse populations in the United States and in Portuguese-speaking countries, and demonstrating advanced lexical and grammatical proficiency in Portuguese.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�354.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT370
classes.subtitle: Modern Brazil through Literature and Film in Translation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Refines translation skills in cultural and consumer-oriented, financial, legal, literary, medical, and technical domains. Emphasis on expanding written proficiency and refining style, translating representative texts from diverse populations in the United States and in Portuguese-speaking countries, and demonstrating advanced lexical and grammatical proficiency in Portuguese.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�354.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT370
classes.subtitle: Modern Brazil through Literature and Film in Translation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is devoted to the study of Brazilian culture and history through representative works of the late 19th- and early 20th-century literature with supplemental films. Taught in English. Available for major/minor credit in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT375
classes.subtitle: Portuguese and Brazilian Fiction in Translation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is devoted to the study of Brazilian culture and history through representative works of the late 19th- and early 20th-century literature with supplemental films. Taught in English. Available for major/minor credit in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT375
classes.subtitle: Portuguese and Brazilian Fiction in Translation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The study of selected literary works by major writers from Portugal, Brazil, and the former Portuguese colonies in Africa.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT382
classes.subtitle: Women Writers:  Brazil and Beyond.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The study of selected literary works by major writers from Portugal, Brazil, and the former Portuguese colonies in Africa.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT382
classes.subtitle: Women Writers:  Brazil and Beyond.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Trajectory of women writers of the Portuguese-speaking world, with main focus on texts of the 20th and 21st century.  Analysis of works within a social-historical and literary context.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT385
classes.subtitle: Verbal Art, Identities, and Nation in Portuguese-Speaking Africa.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Trajectory of women writers of the Portuguese-speaking world, with main focus on texts of the 20th and 21st century.  Analysis of works within a social-historical and literary context.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT385
classes.subtitle: Verbal Art, Identities, and Nation in Portuguese-Speaking Africa.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of representative works of literature, oral tradition, popular music, and film from Lusophone Africa from the Age of Exploration through independence to the present. Focus on literary analysis, sociohistorical context, and cultures. Taught in English. Available for major/minor credit in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT387
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Religious Movements through Film and Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of representative works of literature, oral tradition, popular music, and film from Lusophone Africa from the Age of Exploration through independence to the present. Focus on literary analysis, sociohistorical context, and cultures. Taught in English. Available for major/minor credit in Portuguese if readings and written work are done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT387
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Religious Movements through Film and Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Literary and cinematic representations of Candombl�, Sebastianism, Positivism, and Spiritism from late-19th through the 20th century. Focus on the penetration these forms of religiosity into mainstream Brazilian culture. Taught in English; credit for Portuguese major/minor if readings and work done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT388
classes.subtitle: Portuguese, Brazilian, and African Identity in Film.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Literary and cinematic representations of Candombl�, Sebastianism, Positivism, and Spiritism from late-19th through the 20th century. Focus on the penetration these forms of religiosity into mainstream Brazilian culture. Taught in English; credit for Portuguese major/minor if readings and work done in Portuguese.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT388
classes.subtitle: Portuguese, Brazilian, and African Identity in Film.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of the literary and cultural film production of the Portuguese-speaking world on three continents. Films in Portuguese with English subtitles.Gen Ed: VP, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT395
classes.subtitle: Research for Advanced Students.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of the literary and cultural film production of the Portuguese-speaking world on three continents. Films in Portuguese with English subtitles.Gen Ed: VP, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT395
classes.subtitle: Research for Advanced Students.  1-3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, two major-level courses or permission of the instructor. classes.title: PORT396
classes.subtitle: Independent Study in Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, two major-level courses or permission of the instructor. classes.title: PORT396
classes.subtitle: Independent Study in Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Independent study on a selected topic in Luso-Brazilian literature and culture agreed upon by the student and a member of the faculty.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT398
classes.subtitle: Undergraduate Seminar in Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Independent study on a selected topic in Luso-Brazilian literature and culture agreed upon by the student and a member of the faculty.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT398
classes.subtitle: Undergraduate Seminar in Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A seminar on a previously announced subject.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 9 total credits. 3 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT401
classes.subtitle: Beginning Accelerated Brazilian Portuguese I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A seminar on a previously announced subject.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 9 total credits. 3 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT401
classes.subtitle: Beginning Accelerated Brazilian Portuguese I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Covers levels one and two of the basic language sequence in one semester. Designed for highly motivated undergraduate/graduate language learners, especially those who have experienced success with learning another language. Intensive approach to developing all skills but with an emphasis on speaking. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�401 and PORT�101, 102, 105 or 111.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT402
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Accelerated Brazilian Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Covers levels one and two of the basic language sequence in one semester. Designed for highly motivated undergraduate/graduate language learners, especially those who have experienced success with learning another language. Intensive approach to developing all skills but with an emphasis on speaking. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�401 and PORT�101, 102, 105 or 111.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT402
classes.subtitle: Intermediate Accelerated Brazilian Portuguese II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of PORT�401, covers levels three and four in one semester. Develops all skills, with increasing emphasis on reading, writing, and cultural analysis. Designed for highly motivated undergraduate/graduate language learners, especially those who have experienced success with learning another language. Prepares students for advanced courses. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�402 and PORT�203, PORT�204 or PORT�212.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT408
classes.subtitle: LAC Recitation.  1 Credit.
classes.description: A continuation of PORT�401, covers levels three and four in one semester. Develops all skills, with increasing emphasis on reading, writing, and cultural analysis. Designed for highly motivated undergraduate/graduate language learners, especially those who have experienced success with learning another language. Prepares students for advanced courses. Students may not receive credit for both PORT�402 and PORT�203, PORT�204 or PORT�212.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�102, 111, or 401.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT408
classes.subtitle: LAC Recitation.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Coregistration in a LAC course required. A recitation section for selected courses that promote foreign language proficiency across the curriculum (LAC). classes.title: PORT420
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Language and Culture for the Professions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Coregistration in a LAC course required. A recitation section for selected courses that promote foreign language proficiency across the curriculum (LAC). Weekly discussion and readings in Portuguese.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 3 total credits. 3 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT420
classes.subtitle: Portuguese Language and Culture for the Professions.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Training for effective oral and written communication in the professional world. Builds upon linguistic and sociolinguistic concepts, refining language and enhancing cultural proficiency through extensive writing and speaking practice. Vocabulary, readings and activities relate to social issues, business professions, and the workplace.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Gen Ed: BN, CI.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT501
classes.subtitle: Survey of Portuguese Literature I.  3 Credits.

Builds upon linguistic and sociolinguistic concepts, refining language and enhancing cultural proficiency through extensive writing and speaking practice. Vocabulary, readings and activities relate to social issues, business professions, and the workplace.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Gen Ed: BN, CI.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT501
classes.subtitle: Survey of Portuguese Literature I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to Portuguese literature from its origins through the 18th century.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT526
classes.subtitle: History of the Portuguese Language.  3 Credits.

classes.subtitle: History of the Portuguese Language.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Survey of the history of Portuguese with stress on the characteristics of Brazilian Portuguese and the factors underlying them.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT530
classes.subtitle: Varieties of Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Survey of the history of Portuguese with stress on the characteristics of Brazilian Portuguese and the factors underlying them.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT530
classes.subtitle: Varieties of Portuguese.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to the linguistic analysis of Portuguese. Basic linguistic comparison of Portuguese dialects at different levels of linguistic structure. Emphasis on theoretical background in understanding language variation as a property of natural languages.Gen Ed: SS.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT535
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Drama.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to the linguistic analysis of Portuguese. Basic linguistic comparison of Portuguese dialects at different levels of linguistic structure. Emphasis on theoretical background in understanding language variation as a property of natural languages.Gen Ed: SS.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT535
classes.subtitle: Brazilian Drama.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A study of representative Brazilian plays of the 20th century with a review of the development of the theater in Brazil.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT540
classes.subtitle: Cultural Topics from the Lusophone World.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A study of representative Brazilian plays of the 20th century with a review of the development of the theater in Brazil.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT540
classes.subtitle: Cultural Topics from the Lusophone World.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course examines trends in the cultural production of the Lusophone world from the 19th century to the present, including philosophy, art, film, music, and social practices in Portugal, Brazil, and Lusophone Africa. Topics may include artistic movements, race, class, gender, colonialism, and religion.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Gen Ed: CI, GL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT691H

Topics may include artistic movements, race, class, gender, colonialism, and religion.Requisites: Prerequisite, PORT�204 or 402; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Gen Ed: CI, GL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT691H
classes.subtitle: Honors Thesis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Required of all students reading for honors. Preparation of an essay under the direction of a faculty member. Topic to be approved by thesis director in consultation with honors advisor.Gen Ed: EE- Mentored Research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PORT692H

classes.title: PORT710
classes.subtitle: The Portuguese Novel.  3 Credits.

classes.subtitle: The Portuguese Novel.  3 Credits.
